page.title: 01Thornage Holt/Glaven Valley
page.content: Picturesque Norfolk countryside. Much more undulating than the rest of the county. Even some quite steep hills. Land cover is mainly winter cereals but here are scatterd attractive belts of trees mainly deciduous and a few confiers. Because of the modern methods of farming few people are employed on the land.Neithr of the two villages (Letheringsett and Thornage) has post office. Both have closed in the past 5 years. Thornage now has a restaurant which is listed in the good food guide. To get to Hold which is an attractive town. There ae buses including the successful community mini bus but a car is most useful particulary now that the facilities in the villages are very limited. Hold has a populatin of three or four thousand. It provides good shopping there is a brand new large supermarket
